name: Expo Hotel Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Expo hotel is great for the price you pay. situated near the main train station and 2 metro stops from the centre of Barcelona.
reviews.title: 4th time we have stayed at the Expo Hotel
Centrally located - ideal for sight seeing
reviews.text: this is a quiet location but has cheap bars and some nice places to eat in area.
rooms are well furnished but walls are a bit thin. but we always take ear plugs when we stay in city centre.
reviews.title: A very Nice and modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: tea/ coffee maker in room and Tv and bed is comfy.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel pool is great for the summer after you have had a busy day its nice to be able to sunbathe and have a dip.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Good attention, perfect location lodge, COMFORTABLE ROOMS, in addition they offer an exquisite food, I recommend it
reviews.title: A really special place

reviews.text: Do not stay at this hotel. The staff are rude & unhelpful, there is a terrible smell in the rooms from the bathroom sinks that is made worse when you run the tap. Unless you pay for an upgrade the rooms are more like a 2 star hotel with uncomfrotable beds & the decor, mattress or pillows dont look to have been changed since the 70's. Its very noisy & overpriced. We had to book out a day early but they insisted that we pay for the night anyway. Also there are limited double beds & the twins cannot be pushed together as there is a table mounted to the wall.
reviews.title: Do not stay at the expo hotel.

likes.liked: — When it was time to leave
likes.disliked: — The staff, the smell & twin beds

reviews.text: The first room I was given stank to high heaven of stale smoke, even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room (it had an ash-tray!). However, the reception staff were very friendly, spoke good English, and promptly moved me to another room which was fine. The rooms are very basic and 'cold' feeling. I wouldn't want to spend more than a day or two there. The corridors have a constant smell of bleach and there are no carpets throughout so even the slightest movement of furniture or conversations in adjacent rooms are amplified by the tiled floors. However, the price was reasonable (68 Euros) and I suppose you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: This place is a mixed bag: The executive rooms are bright clean and modern, no problems there. Very close to Barcelona's major train station and metro access. Front desk staff were helpful and spoke fairly good English.
reviews.title: Get a room on the south side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside? If your room is on the North (railway station) side of the hotel bring earplugs, you will be overlooking a 24/7 construction site until the renovations to Sants station are finished. Also, the breakfast was only average, and the public internet access expensive.
reviews.title: Life Saver

reviews.text: My wife and I ended up without a hotel room upon our arrival to Barcelona because of an internet reservation gone bad. So there we were in the middle of the night and after walking around town for a little over an hour we came across the Hotel Expo. Clean, spacious rooms with a view. I couldn't ask for anything more. The price is reasonable and the help we received from the hotel staff just OUTSTANDING. The metro station is about 100 yds away from the hotel entrance but once there you have total access to the entire city. Also, train station Sants is just around the corner. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Good Quality, so, better Executive rooms than the others

reviews.text: Second stay at this Hotel. Great surprise with the new executive rooms. Modern and confortable.
reviews.title: How is this rated 4*??

reviews.text: We stayed at the Expo in July for two nights. We chose the Expo because it is only a few steps from Barcelona Sants station and we could pick a train up from the airport and be in the hotel in about half an hour all for about 2 Euros.
reviews.title: Cannot be faulted

likes.liked: — The rooftop pool and bar area
likes.disliked: — I honestly could not find fault.

reviews.text: The hotel is very smart with courteous and efficient staff, the room was spacious and clean with excellent views of the city and the hotel also offer upgrades to executive rooms for 15 euros a night. The breakfast, which is served until 11am, was the best I have ever experienced with every kind of option open to every kind of diner.
reviews.title: Location is so, so.. otherwise nice hotel.

reviews.text: The highlight was the roof terrace with an outdoor pool with terrific views over Barcelona, just the place to unwind with a cold drink from the bar after a hard days sightseeing.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: There are many restaurants in the area especially out towards the Nou Camp or you are only a couple of stops away from the city centre/Ramblas area.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

likes.liked: — great breakfast, clean and quiet, helpful staff

reviews.text: When we revisit Barcelona in the future there will only be one hotel option for me, The Expo is highly recommended.
reviews.title: great for really busy season

reviews.text: do not stay in this hotel
reviews.title: My Worst experience at this hotel

likes.disliked: — Do not stay in this hotel You will regret it!!!

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: staff unhelpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms were dirty and had dodgy wireing
reviews.title: Another great visit

reviews.text: bathroom was dirty mould on bath and cracked toilet plus mirror had mould on it
reviews.title: overpriced
Really good for the price
reviews.text: restaurant waiters rude and arrogant slamming plates down

Situated ideally next to Sants Estacio for the Metro which cheap, easy air conditioned trains and relatively clean links to the city. Drawback: Major construction activity alongside the hotel which is 7 days a week, starting at 06.30 - 18.00hrs.
reviews.title: Could be quieter

likes.disliked: — Too far from the city activity

reviews.text: If thats not enough the noise from the air conditioning fans make it feel like your your back aboard the aircraft. To cap all that and despite an 8th floor bedroom the view was totally obscured by the sister hotel next door which boasts 23 floors. Best sun was reflected from the 12 floor opposite or experienced at 18.00hrs.
reviews.title: A hotel to enjoy Barcelona

reviews.text: If you can take the noise, not a light sleeper, its ideal as a base to see Barcelona.
reviews.title: do better elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very noisy at night, you could here people walking about above us and doors slamming shut, people talking out in the halls etc at 4am. If you are a light sleeper take earplugs. We hardly slept.
reviews.title: Perfect for City break holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got done staying at Expo Hotel Barcelona. Paid 56 euro a night and got the newer Executive suites without needing to pay more for an upgrade. The room was excellent and so was the rest of the hotel ... the breakfast is superb. I would recommend this hotel to anybody .. it is excellent. When you check in, ask for their Executive Rooms. I am not sure what their non-Executive rooms are like.
reviews.title: This hotel is not nice at all!

likes.disliked: — rooms in desperate need of refurb

reviews.text: There is ethernet internet for 10 euro a day, but I took my comp to the restaurant and lobby and was able to connect for free via the wireless.
reviews.title: Not a 4-star hotel

description: Specially designed to provide maximum comfort and functionality, Expo Hotel Barcelona is located a few meters away from the main train station (Barcelona Sants), 10 minute walking distance from Fira Barcelona (Montjuïc exhibition center) and 5 minutes from Plaza Catalunya in local train. The FC Barcelona stadium, Camp Nou, is just two metro stops away.Its 423 rooms are fully equipped with bathroom, telephone, satellite TV, air conditioning, heating, safe, minibar and terrace. Restaurant, Bar Terrace, outdoor pool with solarium, 9 meeting rooms and parking are also available.Expo Hotel's reception is open 24 hours, providing your stay with great flexibility.
